result.title: Speed up code with python 3 [949a Zebra]
result.content:
Hi, this is my code and there is always timeout. I'm using a linear time algorithm. Wondering if there are ways to speed it up to meet the time limit.

949A][SUBMISSION:37126465 - Зебры ~~~~~ from sys import stdin, stdout

def solution(): life = stdin.readline().strip() result = 1

zeros = [0]
ones = []

if life[0] == '1':
    print("-1")
    return

for i in range(1, len(life)):
    if life[i] == '0':
        if ones:
            index = ones.pop()
            result[index].append(i+1)
            zeros.append(index)
        else:
            result.append([i+1])
            zeros.append(len(result) - 1)
    else:
        if zeros:
            index = zeros.pop()
            result[index].append(i+1)
            ones.append(index)
        else:
            print("-1")
            return
#print(result)
if ones:
    print("-1")
    return
stdout.write(str(len(result)) + '\n')
for i in result:
    stdout.write(str(len(i)) + ' ')
    for j in i:
        stdout.write(str(j) + ' ')
    stdout.write('\n')

solution()

~~~~~
